context: The Estonian word 'leian' is the first-person singular present tense form of the verb 'leidma', which means 'to find'. It's used when someone (I) finds or discovers something. The verb changes form based on the subject and tense, so 'leian' specifically refers to 'I find'. Other forms include 'leiad' (you find), 'leiab' (he/she/it finds), etc.
